q: Will this affect my credit rating?
a: Changing contractual agreements (and insolvency options) can affect your credit file for a time, but the aim is to stabilise things and help you move forward.
We don’t provide loans; our role is to help you reduce and clear debt rather than add more credit.
An IVA can stop/freeze interest and charges, protect assets, and often write off a portion of debt; a DMP is flexible but usually repays the full balance over time.
In an IVA or DMP you keep paying your rent/mortgage as normal and your home isn’t taken, provided payments are maintained.
Yes — moving address is fine during a DMP or IVA; just keep us updated.
Most people keep their car. If repayments are very high, a more affordable vehicle may be discussed.
You upload documents, we review your case, and come back with tailored next steps.

q: Can I still use my cards?
a: On a plan you typically stop using credit cards to avoid new borrowing while creditors review proposals.
You can apply anytime, but acceptance is more likely after your plan completes.
Your normal benefit payments themselves aren’t reduced by starting a plan. We’ll also check for benefit deductions that can be included.
Yes, this service is regulated and your information is handled securely. We can share company details or reviews on request.
An IVA provides legal protection once approved. Before approval (or on a DMP), contact may continue — we’ll advise the safest steps.
A CCJ is a court order stating money is owed; a default marks missed contractual payments. We’ll work to prevent further action and stabilise your situation.
